Invariants for subsetting and subassignment

Source: vignettes/invariants.Rmd
invariants.Rmd

This vignette is an attempt to define invariants in the behavior of $, [[ and [, and their assignment counterparts $<-, [[<- and [<-. For each invariant an example is given. Currently, the vignette("subset") and vignette("subassign") articles give a more comprehensive overview, but will be merged into this article at some point.

library(tibble)
new_df <- function() {
  df <- data.frame(a = 1:4)
  df$b <- letters[5:8]
  df$cd <- list(9, 10:11, 12:14, "text")
  df
}
new_tbl <- function() {
  as_tibble(new_df())
}

Results of the same code for data frames and tibbles are presented side by side:

new_df()
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

In the following, if the results are identical (after converting to a data frame if necessary), only the tibble result is shown, as in the example below. This allows to spot differences easier.

new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Subsetting operations are read-only. The same objects are reused in all examples:

df <- new_df()
tbl <- new_tbl()

We’re also showing examples with hierarchical columns containting a data frame or a matrix where appropriate:

new_tbl2 <- function() {
  tibble(
    e = tbl,
    f = diag(4)
  )
}
new_df2 <- function() {
  df2 <- new_tbl2()
  class(df2) <- "data.frame"
  class(df2$e) <- "data.frame"
  df2
}
df2 <- new_df2()
tbl2 <- new_tbl2()
new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

For subset assignment (short: subassignment), we need a fresh copy of the data for each test. The with_*() functions allow for a more concise notation (with_tbl() and with_*2() omitted here for brevity):

with_df <- function(code, verbose = FALSE) {
  code <- rlang::enexpr(code)
  
  full_code <- rlang::quo({
    df <- new_df()
    !!code
    df
  })
  if (verbose) rlang::expr_print(rlang::quo_get_expr(full_code))
  rlang::eval_tidy(full_code)
}

This function takes an assignment expression and executes it on a fresh copy of the data. The first example prints what’s really executed, further examples omit this output.

with_df(df$a <- rev(df$a), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   df <- new_df()
#>   df$a <- rev(df$a)
#>   df
#> }
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 4 e          9
#> 2 3 f     10, 11
#> 3 2 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 1 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- rev(tbl$a), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   tbl <- new_tbl()
#>   tbl$a <- rev(tbl$a)
#>   tbl
#> }
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>

Subsetting and subassignment

Missing indexes.

x[] and x[,] are equivalent to x.

tbl[]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl[,]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- tbl)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- tbl)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2[]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
tbl2[,]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[] <- tbl2)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[,] <- tbl2)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

Definition of x[i, j].

x[i, j] is equivalent to x[j][i, ] (i and/or j may be missing).

df[1, 1]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl[1, 1]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
 
df[1][1, ]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl[1][1, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
 
tbl[1, 2:3]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   b     cd       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
tbl[2:3][1, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   b     cd       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
tbl2[1, 1:2]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
tbl2[1:2][1, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

Corollaries

x[, j] is equivalent to x[j]; [ always returns a tibble.

df[, 1]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[, 1]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
tbl[1]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
tbl[, 1, drop = FALSE]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
df[1, drop = FALSE]
#> Warning in `[.data.frame`(df, 1, drop =
#> FALSE): 'drop' argument will be ignored
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
#> 4 4
 
tbl[1, drop = FALSE]
#> Warning: `drop` ignored
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 4     4
 
tbl[, 2:3]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   b     cd       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl[2:3]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   b     cd       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2[, 1:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
tbl2[1:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

If i is given in subassignment, only existing columns can be updated.

with_tbl(tbl["c"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     1
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_df(df[2:3, "c"] <- 1)
#>   a b         cd  c
#> 1 1 e          9 NA
#> 2 2 f     10, 11  1
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14  1
#> 4 4 h       text NA
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, "c"] <- 1)
#> Error: Can't index non-existing
#> elements.

Exception

drop = TRUE returns a vector when subsetting a single column with two-dimensional indexing, this is for backward compatibility with code that uses an explicit drop = TRUE to access columns as vectors.

tbl[, 1, drop = TRUE]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
df[1, , drop = TRUE]
#> $a
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $b
#> [1] "e"
#> 
#> $cd
#> $cd[[1]]
#> [1] 9
 
tbl[1, , drop = TRUE]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>

Definition of x[i, ].

Applies vec_slice(, i) to all columns.

tbl[2:3, ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
 
tbl[0:2, ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
 
tbl[-2, ]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 3     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
df[-1:2, ]
#> Error in xj[i]: only 0's may be
#> mixed with negative subscripts
 
tbl[-1:2, ]
#> Error: Can't subset with a mix of
#> negative and positive indices
 
tbl[NA_integer_, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       a b     cd    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
tbl2[NA_integer_, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd    f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>    NA    NA    NA
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
tbl[c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE), ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
 
tbl[TRUE, ]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl[NA, ]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 2    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 4    NA <NA>  <NULL>

Corollary

Out-of-bounds indexing (and recycling of logical vectors of size > 1) is not supported.

df[c(TRUE, FALSE), ]
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE), ]
#> Warning: Length of logical index must be
#> 1 or 4, not 2
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
 
df[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ]
#>     a    b         cd
#> 1   1    e          9
#> 3   3    g 12, 13, 14
#> NA NA <NA>       NULL
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ]
#> Warning: Length of logical index must be
#> 1 or 4, not 5
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
with_df(df[c(TRUE, FALSE), ] <- df[1, ])
#>   a b     cd
#> 1 1 e      9
#> 2 2 f 10, 11
#> 3 1 e      9
#> 4 4 h   text
 
with_tbl(tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Warning: Length of logical index must be
#> 1 or 4, not 2
#> Vector of length 3 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 2. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df(df[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), :
#> non-existent rows not allowed
 
with_tbl(tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), ] <- tbl[1, ])
#> Warning: Length of logical index must be
#> 1 or 4, not 5
#> Error in if (new_nrow != nrow) {:
#> missing value where TRUE/FALSE
#> needed

Subassignment corollary

The data type of existing columns can be changed only if i is missing.

with_df(df[2:3, 1] <- "x")
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 x f     10, 11
#> 3 x g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, 1] <- "x")
#> No common type for `value`
#> <character>
#> and `x` <integer>.
 
with_df(df[2:3, 2] <- 0)
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 0     10, 11
#> 3 3 0 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, 2] <- 0)
#> No common type for `value` <double>
#> and
#> `x` <character>.
 
with_df(df[2:3, 3] <- 0)
#>   a b   cd
#> 1 1 e    9
#> 2 2 f    0
#> 3 3 g    0
#> 4 4 h text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, 3] <- 0)
#> No common type for `value` <double>
#> and
#> `x` <list>.
 
with_df2(df2[2:3, 1] <- 0)
#>   e.a e.b e.cd f.1 f.2 f.3 f.4
#> 1   1   e    9   1   0   0   0
#> 2   0   0    0   0   1   0   0
#> 3   0   0    0   0   0   1   0
#> 4   4   h text   0   0   0   1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:3, 1] <- 0)
#> No common type for `value` <double>
#> and `x` <tbl_df<
#> a : integer
#> b : character
#> cd: list
#> >>.
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:3, 2] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     0     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

Only values of size one can be recycled.

with_df(df[2:3, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#>   a b   cd
#> 1 1 e    9
#> 2 0 x NULL
#> 3 0 x NULL
#> 4 4 h text
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 x     <NULL>   
#> 3     0 x     <NULL>   
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- list(0:1, c("x", "y"), list(NULL, "")))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 x     <NULL>   
#> 3     1 y     <chr [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[2:4, ] <- list(0:1, "x", list(NULL)))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:4, , value = list(0:1, "x", list(:
#> replacement element 1 has 2 rows,
#> need 3
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:4, ] <- list(0:1, "x", list(NULL)))
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df2(df2[2:4, ] <- list(df[1, ]))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:4, , value = list(structure(list(:
#> replacement element 1 is a
#> matrix/data frame of 1 row, need 3
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:4, ] <- list(tbl[1, ]))
#> No common type for `x` <tbl_df<
#> a : integer
#> b : character
#> cd: list
#> >> and `y` <double[,4]>.
 
with_df2(df2[2:4, ] <- list(df[2:3, ]))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:4, , value = list(structure(list(:
#> replacement element 1 is a
#> matrix/data frame of 2 rows, need 3
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2:4, ] <- list(tbl[2:3, ]))
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Exception

For compatibility reasons only a warning is issued for indexing beyond the number of rows. Appending rows right at the end of the existing data is supported, without warning.

df[5, ]
#>     a    b   cd
#> NA NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[5, ]
#> Warning: Row indexes must be between
#> 0 and the number of rows. Use `NA` as
#> row index to obtain a row full of `NA`
#> values.
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       a b     cd    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
df[5:7, ]
#>       a    b   cd
#> NA   NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.1 NA <NA> NULL
#> NA.2 NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[5:7, ]
#> Warning: Row indexes must be between
#> 0 and the number of rows. Use `NA` as
#> row index to obtain a row full of `NA`
#> values.
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       a b     cd    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 2    NA <NA>  <NULL>
#> 3    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
df[6, ]
#>     a    b   cd
#> NA NA <NA> NULL
 
tbl[6, ]
#> Warning: Row indexes must be between
#> 0 and the number of rows. Use `NA` as
#> row index to obtain a row full of `NA`
#> values.
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       a b     cd    
#>   <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1    NA <NA>  <NULL>
 
with_df(df[5, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
#> 5 0 x       NULL
 
with_tbl(tbl[5, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
#> 5     0 x     <NULL>
 
with_df(df[5:7, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
#> 5 0 x       NULL
#> 6 0 x       NULL
#> 7 0 x       NULL
 
with_tbl(tbl[5:7, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#> # A tibble: 7 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
#> 5     0 x     <NULL>   
#> 6     0 x     <NULL>   
#> 7     0 x     <NULL>
 
with_df(df[6, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#>    a    b         cd
#> 1  1    e          9
#> 2  2    f     10, 11
#> 3  3    g 12, 13, 14
#> 4  4    h       text
#> 5 NA <NA>       NULL
#> 6  0    x       NULL
 
with_tbl(tbl[6, ] <- list(0, "x", list(NULL)))
#> Error in
#> error_new_rows_at_end_only(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_new_rows_at_end_only"

Definition of x[[i, j]].

x[[i, j]] is equivalent to x[i, ][[j]].

tbl[[1, 1]]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl[1, ][[1]]
#> [1] 1
 
df[[1, 3]]
#> [1] 9
 
tbl[[1, 3]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
 
tbl[1, ][[3]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
 
df2[[1, 1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl2[[1, 1]]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
tbl2[1, ][[1]]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
 
df2[[1, 2]]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl2[[1, 2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
 
tbl2[1, ][[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0

Corollaries

x[[i, j]] and x[i, ][[j]] can be used interchangeably on the LHS or RHS of an assignment for the four principal column types:

  • atomic: df[[1]]
  • list: df[[3]]
  • data frame: df2[[1]]
  • matrix: df2[[2]] 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 1]] <- tbl[2, ][[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, 1] <- list(tbl[[2, 1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     2 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[1, 3]] <- df[2, ][[3]])
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e     10, 11
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 3]] <- tbl[2, ][[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <int [2]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[1, 3] <- list(df[[2, 3]]))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1, 3, value = list(10:11)): replacement
#> element 1 has 2 rows to replace 1 rows
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e         10
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, 3] <- list(tbl[[2, 3]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <int [2]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df2(df2[[1, 1]] <- df2[2, ][[1]])
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> iseq, value = structure(list(a = 2L,
#> : replacement has 1 row, data has 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1, 1]] <- tbl2[2, ][[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     2 f     <int [2…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[1, 1] <- list(df2[[2, 1]]))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1, 1, value = list(c("e", "f", "g", :
#> replacement element 1 has 4 rows to
#> replace 1 rows
#>   e.a e.b       e.cd f.1 f.2 f.3 f.4
#> 1   e   e          e   1   0   0   0
#> 2   2   f     10, 11   0   1   0   0
#> 3   3   g 12, 13, 14   0   0   1   0
#> 4   4   h       text   0   0   0   1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1, 1] <- list(tbl2[[2, 1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     2 f     <int [2…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[[1, 2]] <- df2[2, ][[2]])
#> Error in x[[jseq]][[iseq]] <- value:
#> more elements supplied than there
#> are to replace
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1, 2]] <- tbl2[2, ][[2]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     1     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[1, 2] <- list(df2[[2, 2]]))
#>   e.a e.b       e.cd f.1 f.2 f.3 f.4
#> 1   1   e          9   0   0   0   0
#> 2   2   f     10, 11   0   1   0   0
#> 3   3   g 12, 13, 14   0   0   1   0
#> 4   4   h       text   0   0   0   1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1, 2] <- list(tbl2[[2, 2]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     1     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     0     1     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     0     0     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

x[[i, j]] is equivalent to x[i, j][[1]] with the additional requirement vec_as_index(j) scalar.

tbl[[1, 2]]
#> [1] "e"
 
tbl[1, 2][[1]]
#> [1] "e"
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1, 2]] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, 2] <- list("x"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

[[ requires a scalar i index?

df[[1:2, 1]]
#> Error in col[[i, exact = exact]]:
#> attempt to select more than one
#> element in vectorIndex
 
tbl[[1:2, 1]]
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_df(df[[1:2, 1]] <- 0)
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1:2, 1, value = 0): only a single
#> element should be replaced
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:2, 1]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"

Corollary

x[[i, j]] always returns an object of size 1.

vctrs::vec_size(tbl[[2, 1]])
#> [1] 1
 
vctrs::vec_size(df[[2, 3]])
#> [1] 2
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl[[2, 3]])
#> [1] 1
 
vctrs::vec_size(df2[[2, 1]])
#> [1] 4
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl2[[2, 1]])
#> [1] 1
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl2[[2, 2]])
#> [1] 1
 
vctrs::vec_size(df[[NA, 1]])
#> Error in col[[i, exact = exact]]:
#> subscript out of bounds
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl[[NA, 1]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
vctrs::vec_size(df[[NA, 3]])
#> [1] 0
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl[[NA, 3]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
vctrs::vec_size(df2[[NA, 1]])
#> [1] 0
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl2[[NA, 1]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
vctrs::vec_size(df2[[NA, 2]])
#> Error in col[[i, exact = exact]]:
#> subscript out of bounds
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl2[[NA, 2]])
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"

Definition of x$name.

x$name is equivalent to x[["name"]].

tbl$a
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[["a"]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl$cd
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl[["cd"]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[["a"]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2$e
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2[["e"]]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2$f
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    1    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    1    0
#> [4,]    0    0    0    1
 
tbl2[["f"]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    1    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    1    0
#> [4,]    0    0    0    1
 
with_df2(df2$e <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> e, value = structure(list(a = 1L, b
#> = "e", : replacement has 1 row, data
#> has 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2$e <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     1     0
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     0     1
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[["e"]] <- df[1, ])
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> "e", value = structure(list(a = 1L,
#> : replacement has 1 row, data has 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[["e"]] <- tbl[1, ])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     1     0
#> 3     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     0     1
#> 4     1 e     <dbl [1…     0     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2$f <- df2$f[1, , drop = FALSE])
#> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> f, value = structure(c(1, 0, 0, 0),
#> .Dim = c(1L, : replacement has 1
#> row, data has 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2$f <- tbl2$f[1, , drop = FALSE])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     1     0     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     1     0     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     1     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>
 
with_df2(df2[["f"]] <- df2[["f"]][1, , drop = FALSE])
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> "f", value = structure(c(1, 0, 0, :
#> replacement has 1 row, data has 4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[["f"]] <- tbl2[["f"]][1, , drop = FALSE])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd      f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1…     1     0     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2…     1     0     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3…     1     0     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1…     1     0     0
#> # … with 1 more variable: [,4] <dbl>

Corollary

$ does not implement partial matching. For compatibility with code that probes columns and compares with NULL, only a warning is raised.

df$c
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl$c
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: `c`.
#> NULL
 
df[["c"]]
#> NULL
 
tbl[["c"]]
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: `c`.
#> NULL
 
with_tbl(tbl$c <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     0
 
with_tbl(tbl[["c"]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     0

Subsetting

Definition of x[j].

Equivalent to restoring .subset(x, vec_as_index(j)) to the original class.

tbl[1:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       a b    
#>   <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 e    
#> 2     2 f    
#> 3     3 g    
#> 4     4 h
 
tbl[0:2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       a b    
#>   <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 e    
#> 2     2 f    
#> 3     3 g    
#> 4     4 h
 
tbl[-2]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       a cd       
#>   <int> <list>   
#> 1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 <int [2]>
#> 3     3 <int [3]>
#> 4     4 <chr [1]>
 
df[-1:2]
#> Error in `[.default`(df, -1:2): only
#> 0's may be mixed with negative
#> subscripts
 
tbl[-1:2]
#> Error: Can't subset with a mix of
#> negative and positive indices
 
tbl["b"]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 1
#>   b    
#>   <chr>
#> 1 e    
#> 2 f    
#> 3 g    
#> 4 h
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       a cd       
#>   <int> <list>   
#> 1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 <int [2]>
#> 3     3 <int [3]>
#> 4     4 <chr [1]>
 
tbl[TRUE]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Corollaries

Out-of-bounds indexing (and recycling of logical vectors of size > 1) is not supported.

df[4]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df, 4):
#> undefined columns selected
 
tbl[4]
#> Error: Can't index beyond the end of
#> a vector.
#> The vector has length 3 and you've
#> tried to subset element 4.
 
df[-4]
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
tbl[-4]
#> Error: Can't index beyond the end of
#> a vector.
#> The vector has length 3 and you've
#> tried to subset element 4.
 
df["c"]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df, "c"):
#> undefined columns selected
 
tbl["c"]
#> Error: Can't index non-existing
#> elements.
 
df[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE)]
#>   a         cd
#> 1 1          9
#> 2 2     10, 11
#> 3 3 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4       text
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE)]
#> Error: Logical indices must have
#> length 1 or be as long as the
#> indexed vector.
#> The vector has size 3 whereas the
#> index has size 4.
 
df[c(TRUE, FALSE)]
#>   a         cd
#> 1 1          9
#> 2 2     10, 11
#> 3 3 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4       text
 
tbl[c(TRUE, FALSE)]
#> Error: Logical indices must have
#> length 1 or be as long as the
#> indexed vector.
#> The vector has size 3 whereas the
#> index has size 2.

x[j] retains the number of rows in the input.

nrow(tbl[])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl[1])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl[3])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl2[1])
#> [1] 4
 
nrow(tbl2[2])
#> [1] 4

Exception

NA columns are not supported.

df[NA]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df, NA):
#> undefined columns selected
 
tbl[NA]
#> Can't use numeric NA as column index
#> with `[` at positions 1, 2, 3.
 
df[NA_integer_]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df,
#> NA_integer_): undefined columns
#> selected
 
tbl[NA_integer_]
#> Can't use numeric NA as column index
#> with `[` at position 1.
 
df[NA_character_]
#> Error in `[.data.frame`(df,
#> NA_character_): undefined columns
#> selected
 
tbl[NA_character_]
#> Can't use numeric NA as column index
#> with `[` at position 1.

Definition of x[[j]].

x[[j]] is equivalent to .subset2(x, j).

tbl[[1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
.subset2(tbl, 1)
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
tbl[[3]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
.subset2(tbl, 3)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 9
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 10 11
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 12 13 14
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "text"
 
tbl2[[1]]
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
.subset2(tbl2, 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
tbl2[[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    1    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    1    0
#> [4,]    0    0    0    1
 
.subset2(tbl2, 2)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    1    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    1    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    1    0
#> [4,]    0    0    0    1

Corollary

[[ requires a scalar j index.

tbl[[1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
 
df[[1:2]]
#> [1] 2
 
tbl[[1:2]]
#> Warning: Calling `[[` with a vector
#> of length 2 (recursive subsetting)
#> is deprecated and will eventually be
#> converted to an error.
#> [1] 2
 
df[[1:3]]
#> Error in .subset2(x, i, exact =
#> exact): recursive indexing failed at
#> level 2
 
tbl[[1:3]]
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"

x[[j]] always returns an object of size nrow(x).

vctrs::vec_size(tbl[[1]])
#> [1] 4
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl[[3]])
#> [1] 4
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl2[[1]])
#> [1] 4
 
vctrs::vec_size(tbl2[[2]])
#> [1] 4

Subassignment

Treatment of atomic or NULL on the RHS.

x[i, j] <- a is equivalent to x[i, j] <- list(a) if is_atomic(a) or is_null(a).

with_tbl(tbl[1] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- NULL)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   b     cd       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(NULL))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   b     cd       
#>   <chr> <list>   
#> 1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4 h     <chr [1]>

Treatment of list of length 1 on the RHS.

x[i, j] <- a is equivalent to x[i, j] <- rep_along(j, a) if is_list(a, 1).

with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     0     0 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0     0 <int [2]>
#> 3     0     0 <int [3]>
#> 4     0     0 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list(0, 0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     0     0 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0     0 <int [2]>
#> 3     0     0 <int [3]>
#> 4     0     0 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:3] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b    cd
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     0     0
#> 2     0     0     0
#> 3     0     0     0
#> 4     0     0     0
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:3] <- list(0, 0, 0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b    cd
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     0     0
#> 2     0     0     0
#> 3     0     0     0
#> 4     0     0     0

Corollary

Only lists of length one are recycled.

with_df(df[1:2] <- list(0, 0, 0))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1:2, value = list(0, 0, 0)): provided 3
#> variables to replace 2 variables
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 0 0          9
#> 2 0 0     10, 11
#> 3 0 0 12, 13, 14
#> 4 0 0       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list(0, 0, 0))
#> Vector of length 3 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 2. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df(df[1:3] <- list(0, 0))
#>   a b cd
#> 1 0 0  0
#> 2 0 0  0
#> 3 0 0  0
#> 4 0 0  0
 
with_tbl(tbl[1:3] <- list(0, 0))
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 3. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Definition of x[j] <- list(...).

x[j] <- a is equivalent to x[[jj]] <- ... in a loop, keeping only columns that are assigned non-NULL values.

# With logic for defining names of new columns, see below
j <- vec_as_new_col_index(j, x, a)

is_data <- !map_lgl(a, is_null)

# Create or update
for (jj in which(is_data)) x[[ j[[jj]] ]] <- vec_recycle(a[[jj]], nrow(x))

# Remove
j_remove <- j[!is_data]
if (has_length(j_remove)) x <- x[-j_remove]
with_tbl(tbl[1:2] <- list("x", 4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a         b cd       
#>   <chr> <int> <list>   
#> 1 x         4 <dbl [1]>
#> 2 x         3 <int [2]>
#> 3 x         2 <int [3]>
#> 4 x         1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[c("cd", "c", "b")] <- list("x", 4:1, NULL))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a cd        c
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 x         4
#> 2     2 x         3
#> 3     3 x         2
#> 4     4 x         1

NA indexes are not supported.

with_df(df[NA] <- list("x"))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA, value = list("x")): missing
#> values are not allowed in
#> subscripted assignments of data
#> frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA] <- list("x"))
#> Can't use numeric NA as column index
#> with `[` at positions 1, 2, 3.
 
with_df(df[NA_integer_] <- list("x"))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA_integer_, value = list("x")):
#> missing values are not allowed in
#> subscripted assignments of data
#> frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA_integer_] <- list("x"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd        ``   
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <chr>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> x    
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> x    
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> x    
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> x
 
with_df(df[NA_character_] <- list("x"))
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> NA_character_, value = list("x")):
#> missing values are not allowed in
#> subscripted assignments of data
#> frames
 
with_tbl(tbl[NA_character_] <- list("x"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd        NA   
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <chr>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> x    
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> x    
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> x    
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> x

The name of new columns is determined by the LHS, the RHS, or by name repair (in that order of preference).

with_tbl(tbl[c("d", "c")] <- tibble("x", d = 4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 5
#>       a b     cd        d         c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> x         4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> x         3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> x         2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> x         1
 
with_tbl(tbl[3:4] <- list("x", c = 4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd        c
#>   <int> <chr> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e     x         4
#> 2     2 f     x         3
#> 3     3 g     x         2
#> 4     4 h     x         1
 
with_df(df[4] <- list(4:1))
#>   a b         cd V4
#> 1 1 e          9  4
#> 2 2 f     10, 11  3
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14  2
#> 4 4 h       text  1
 
with_tbl(tbl[4] <- list(4:1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd         ...4
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1

Corollary

When adding or removing columns, i cannot be given (by definition of x[i, j]).

with_df(df[2:3, "c"] <- list(0))
#>   a b         cd  c
#> 1 1 e          9 NA
#> 2 2 f     10, 11  0
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14  0
#> 4 4 h       text NA
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, "c"] <- list(0))
#> Error: Can't index non-existing
#> elements.
 
with_df(df[2:3, "b"] <- NULL)
#> Error in x[[jj]][iseq] <- vjj:
#> replacement has length zero
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, "b"] <- NULL)
#> `value` must be a vector, not NULL

When appending rows, j cannot be given (by definition of x[i, j]).

with_df(df[5, "a"] <- list(0))
#>   a    b         cd
#> 1 1    e          9
#> 2 2    f     10, 11
#> 3 3    g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4    h       text
#> 5 0 <NA>       NULL
 
with_tbl(tbl[5, "a"] <- list(0))
#> Vector of length 5 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

Definition of x[[j]] <- a.

x[[j]] <- a is equivalent to x[j] <- list(a).

with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[3]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e         0
#> 2     2 f         0
#> 3     3 g         0
#> 4     4 h         0
 
with_tbl(tbl[3] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e         0
#> 2     2 f         0
#> 3     3 g         0
#> 4     4 h         0
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       e f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     1     0     0     0
#> 2     0     0     1     0     0
#> 3     0     0     0     1     0
#> 4     0     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       e f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0     1     0     0     0
#> 2     0     0     1     0     0
#> 3     0     0     0     1     0
#> 4     0     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd           f
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     0
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2] <- list(0))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd           f
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     0
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     0
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     0
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     0

[[<- requires a scalar j index.

with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 0)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     0 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     0 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     0 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     0 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[1:2]] <- 0)
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: more
#> elements supplied than there are to
#> replace
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:2]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"
 
with_df(df[[1:3]] <- 0)
#> Error in `[[<-`(`*tmp*`, i, value =
#> value): recursive indexing failed at
#> level 2
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:3]] <- 0)
#> Error in error_need_scalar(): could
#> not find function
#> "error_need_scalar"

Corollary

x[[j]] <- a requires vec_size(a) == nrow(x) or vec_size(a) == 1.

with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df[[1]] <- 3:1)
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1, value = 3:1): replacement has 3
#> rows, data has 4
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 3:1)
#> Vector of length 3 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.
 
with_df(df[[1]] <- 2:1)
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 2 e          9
#> 2 1 f     10, 11
#> 3 2 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 1 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- 2:1)
#> Vector of length 2 cannot be
#> recycled to
#> length 4. Only vectors of length one
#> or
#> of the same length can be recycled.

x[j] and x[[j]] can be used interchangeably on the LHS or RHS of an assignment for the four principal column types:

  • atomic: df[[1]]
  • list: df[[3]]
  • data frame: df2[[1]]
  • matrix: df2[[2]] 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- tbl[[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a         b     cd       
#>   <list>    <chr> <list>   
#> 1 <dbl [1]> e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 <int [2]> f     <int [2]>
#> 3 <int [3]> g     <int [3]>
#> 4 <chr [1]> h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- tbl2[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>     a$a $b    $cd       b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1]] <- tbl2[[2]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4] b     cd      
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <list>  
#> 1     1     0     0     0 e     <dbl [1…
#> 2     0     1     0     0 f     <int [2…
#> 3     0     0     1     0 g     <int [3…
#> 4     0     0     0     1 h     <chr [1…
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(tbl[[3]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a         b     cd       
#>   <list>    <chr> <list>   
#> 1 <dbl [1]> e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 <int [2]> f     <int [2]>
#> 3 <int [3]> g     <int [3]>
#> 4 <chr [1]> h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(tbl2[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>     a$a $b    $cd       b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1] <- list(tbl2[[2]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4] b     cd      
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <list>  
#> 1     1     0     0     0 e     <dbl [1…
#> 2     0     1     0     0 f     <int [2…
#> 3     0     0     1     0 g     <int [3…
#> 4     0     0     0     1 h     <chr [1…
 
with_tbl(tbl[[3]] <- tbl[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         1
#> 2     2 f         2
#> 3     3 g         3
#> 4     4 h         4
 
with_tbl(tbl[[3]] <- tbl2[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b      cd$a $b    $cd      
#>   <int> <chr> <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e         1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f         2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g         3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h         4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[3]] <- tbl2[[2]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <int> <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e          1     0     0     0
#> 2     2 f          0     1     0     0
#> 3     3 g          0     0     1     0
#> 4     4 h          0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[3] <- list(tbl[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         1
#> 2     2 f         2
#> 3     3 g         3
#> 4     4 h         4
 
with_tbl(tbl[3] <- list(tbl2[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b      cd$a $b    $cd      
#>   <int> <chr> <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e         1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f         2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g         3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h         4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[3] <- list(tbl2[[2]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <int> <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e          1     0     0     0
#> 2     2 f          0     1     0     0
#> 3     3 g          0     0     1     0
#> 4     4 h          0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1]] <- tbl[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       e f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     1     0     0     0
#> 2     2     0     1     0     0
#> 3     3     0     0     1     0
#> 4     4     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1]] <- tbl[[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   e         f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <list>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 <dbl [1]>     1     0     0     0
#> 2 <int [2]>     0     1     0     0
#> 3 <int [3]>     0     0     1     0
#> 4 <chr [1]>     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[1]] <- tbl2[[2]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   e[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4] f[,1]  [,2]
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     0     0     0     1     0
#> 2     0     1     0     0     0     1
#> 3     0     0     1     0     0     0
#> 4     0     0     0     1     0     0
#> # … with 2 more variables: [,3] <dbl>,
#> #   [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1] <- list(tbl[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>       e f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     1     0     0     0
#> 2     2     0     1     0     0
#> 3     3     0     0     1     0
#> 4     4     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1] <- list(tbl[[3]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   e         f[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4]
#>   <list>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 <dbl [1]>     1     0     0     0
#> 2 <int [2]>     0     1     0     0
#> 3 <int [3]>     0     0     1     0
#> 4 <chr [1]>     0     0     0     1
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[1] <- list(tbl2[[2]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   e[,1]  [,2]  [,3]  [,4] f[,1]  [,2]
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     0     0     0     1     0
#> 2     0     1     0     0     0     1
#> 3     0     0     1     0     0     0
#> 4     0     0     0     1     0     0
#> # … with 2 more variables: [,3] <dbl>,
#> #   [,4] <dbl>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- tbl[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd           f
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     2
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     3
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- tbl[[3]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd       f        
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[[2]] <- tbl2[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd       f$a $b    $cd   
#>   <int> <chr> <list>  <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl […     1 e     <dbl …
#> 2     2 f     <int […     2 f     <int …
#> 3     3 g     <int […     3 g     <int …
#> 4     4 h     <chr […     4 h     <chr …
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2] <- list(tbl[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd           f
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     2
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     3
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     4
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2] <- list(tbl[[3]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd       f        
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]> <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]> <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]> <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]> <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl2(tbl2[2] <- list(tbl2[[1]]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>     e$a $b    $cd       f$a $b    $cd   
#>   <int> <chr> <list>  <int> <chr> <list>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl […     1 e     <dbl …
#> 2     2 f     <int […     2 f     <int …
#> 3     3 g     <int […     3 g     <int …
#> 4     4 h     <chr […     4 h     <chr …

Columns don’t have inner names.

with_df(df$x <- c(a = 4, b = 3, c = 2, d = 1))$x
#> [1] 4 3 2 1
 
with_tbl(tbl$x <- c(a = 4, b = 3, c = 2, d = 1))$x
#> a b c d 
#> 4 3 2 1
 
with_df(df$x <- rlang::set_names(letters[4:1]))$x
#> [1] "d" "c" "b" "a"
 
with_tbl(tbl$x <- rlang::set_names(letters[4:1]))$x
#>   d   c   b   a 
#> "d" "c" "b" "a"

Exception

List columns can have inner names:

with_tbl(tbl$x <- list(a = 4, b = 3, c = 2, d = 1))$x
#> $a
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $b
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $c
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $d
#> [1] 1
 
stopifnot(identical(tbl, new_tbl()))

Contents

  • Subsetting and subassignment
    • Missing indexes.
    • Definition of x[i, j].
    • Definition of x[i, ].
    • Definition of x[[i, j]].
    • [[ requires a scalar i index?
    • Definition of x$name.
  • Subsetting
    • Definition of x[j].
    • Definition of x[[j]].
  • Subassignment
    • Treatment of atomic or NULL on the RHS.
    • Treatment of list of length 1 on the RHS.
    • Definition of x[j] <- list(...).
    • Definition of x[[j]] <- a.
    • Columns don’t have inner names.

tibble is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.
